alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 8:12AM EST until December 19 at 11:48AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern Vermont, including the following counties, in central Vermont, Orange. In southern Vermont, Rutland and Windsor. * WHEN...Until 215 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 AM EST, Emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area, including, but not limited to Rt. 14 in Sharon, Rt.103 in Ludlow, and several areas in Chester. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Chester, White River Junction, Reading, Woodstock Village, Bridgewater, West Windsor, Plymouth, Hartland, Cavendish, Hartland Four Corners, Pomfret, Windsor, Barnard, Quechee, Ludlow Village, Baltimore, Perkinsville Village, Weathersfield and Ludlow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
